metadata.title: USN-3789-1 -- ClamAV vulnerability
metadata.description: It was discovered that ClamAV incorrectly handled unpacking MEW executables. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause ClamAV to crash, resulting in a denial of service.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-3789-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  libclamav-dev - 0.100.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.18.04.1 clamav-testfiles - 0.100.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.18.04.1 clamav-base - 0.100.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.18.04.1 clamav - 0.100.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.18.04.1 libclamav7 - 0.100.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.18.04.1 clamav-daemon - 0.100.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.18.04.1 clamav-docs - 0.100.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.18.04.1 clamav-milter - 0.100.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.18.04.1 clamav-freshclam - 0.100.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.18.04.1 clamdscan - 0.100.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.18.04.1 No subscription required
